55/*!
56 \brief Clip dynamic range for signal higher than specified
57
58 \param svect - sparse vector to do clipping
59 \param high_bit - max bit (inclusive) allowed for this signal vector
60
61
62 \ingroup svalgo
63 \sa dynamic_range_clip_low
64*/
65template<typename SV>
66void dynamic_range_clip_high(SV& svect, unsigned high_bit)
67{
68 unsigned sv_planes = svect.slices();
69
70 BM_ASSERT(sv_planes > high_bit && high_bit > 0);
71
72 typename SV::bvector_type bv_acc;
73 unsigned i;
74
75 // combine all the high bits into accumulator vector
76 for (i = high_bit+1; i < sv_planes; ++i)
77 {
78 if (typename SV::bvector_type* bv = svect.slice(i))
79 {
80 bv_acc.bit_or(*bv);
81 svect.free_slice(i);
82 }
83 } // for i
84
85 // set all bits ON for all low vectors, which happen to be clipped
86 for (i = high_bit; true; --i)
87 {
88 typename SV::bvector_type* bv = svect.get_create_slice(i);
89 bv->bit_or(bv_acc);
90 if (!i)
91 break;
92 } // for i
93}
94
95
96/*!
97 \brief Clip dynamic range for signal lower than specified (boost)
98
99 \param svect - sparse vector to do clipping
100 \param low_bit - low bit (inclusive) allowed for this signal vector
101
102 \ingroup svalgo
103 \sa dynamic_range_clip_high
104*/
105template<typename SV>
106void dynamic_range_clip_low(SV& svect, unsigned low_bit)
107{
108 if (low_bit == 0) return; // nothing to do
109 BM_ASSERT(svect.slices() > low_bit);
110
111 unsigned sv_planes = svect.slices();
112 typename SV::bvector_type bv_acc1;
113 unsigned i;
114
115 // combine all the high bits into accumulator vector
116 for (i = low_bit+1; i < sv_planes; ++i)
117 {
118 if (typename SV::bvector_type* bv = svect.slice(i))
119 bv_acc1.bit_or(*bv);
120 } // for i
121
122 // accumulate all vectors below the clipping point
123 typename SV::bvector_type bv_acc2;
124 typename SV::bvector_type* bv_low_plane = svect.get_create_slice(low_bit);
125
126 for (i = low_bit-1; true; --i)
127 {
128 if (typename SV::bvector_type* bv = svect.slice(i))
129 {
130 bv_acc2.bit_or(*bv);
131 svect.free_slice(i);
132 if (i == 0)
133 break;
134 }
135 } // for i
136
137 // now we want to set 1 in the clipping low plane based on
138 // exclusive or (XOR) between upper and lower parts)
139 // as a result high signal (any bits in the upper planes) gets
140 // slightly lower value (due to clipping) low signal gets amplified
141 // (lower contrast algorithm)
142
143 bv_acc1.bit_xor(bv_acc2);
144 bv_low_plane->bit_or(bv_acc1);
145}
146
147/**
148 Find first mismatch (element which is different) between two sparse vectors
149 (uses linear scan in bit-vector planes)
150
151 Function works with both NULL and NOT NULL vectors
152 NULL means unassigned (uncertainty), so first mismatch NULL is a mismatch
153 even if values in vectors can be formally the same (i.e. 0)
154
155 @param sv1 - vector 1
156 @param sv2 - vector 2
157 @param midx - mismatch index
158 @param null_proc - defines if we want to include (not) NULL
159 vector into comparison (bm::use_null) or not.
160 By default search takes NULL vector into account
161
162 @return true if mismatch found
163
164 @sa sparse_vector_find_mismatch
165
166 \ingroup svalgo
167*/
168template<typename SV>
169bool sparse_vector_find_first_mismatch(const SV& sv1,
170 const SV& sv2,
171 typename SV::size_type& midx,
172 bm::null_support null_proc = bm::use_null)
173{
174 typename SV::size_type mismatch = bm::id_max;
175 bool found = false;
176
177 unsigned sv_idx = 0;
178
179 unsigned planes1 = (unsigned)sv1.get_bmatrix().rows();
180 BM_ASSERT(planes1);
181
182 typename SV::bvector_type_const_ptr bv_null1 = sv1.get_null_bvector();
183 typename SV::bvector_type_const_ptr bv_null2 = sv2.get_null_bvector();
184
185 // for RSC vector do NOT compare NULL planes
186
187 if (bm::conditional<SV::is_rsc_support::value>::test())
188 {
189 //--planes1;
190 }
191 else // regular sparse vector - may have NULL planes
192 {
193 if (null_proc == bm::use_null)
194 {
195 if (bv_null1 && bv_null2) // both (not) NULL vectors present
196 {
197 bool f = bv_null1->find_first_mismatch(*bv_null2, midx, mismatch);
198 if (f && (midx < mismatch)) // better mismatch found
199 {
200 found = f; mismatch = midx;
201 }
202 }
203 else // one or both NULL vectors are not present
204 {
205 if (bv_null1)
206 {
207 typename SV::bvector_type bv_tmp; // TODO: get rid of temp bv
208 bv_tmp.resize(sv2.size());
209 bv_tmp.invert(); // turn into true NULL vector
210
211 // find first NULL value (mismatch)
212 bool f = bv_null1->find_first_mismatch(bv_tmp, midx, mismatch);
213 if (f && (midx < mismatch)) // better mismatch found
214 {
215 found = f; mismatch = midx;
216 }
217 }
218 if (bv_null2)
219 {
220 typename SV::bvector_type bv_tmp; // TODO: get rid of temp bv
221 bv_tmp.resize(sv1.size());
222 bv_tmp.invert();
223
224 bool f = bv_null2->find_first_mismatch(bv_tmp, midx, mismatch);
225 if (f && (midx < mismatch)) // better mismatch found
226 {
227 found = f; mismatch = midx;
228 }
229 }
230 }
231 } // null_proc
232 }
233
234 for (unsigned i = 0; mismatch && (i < planes1); ++i)
235 {
236 typename SV::bvector_type_const_ptr bv1 = sv1.get_slice(i);
237 if (bv1 == bv_null1)
238 bv1 = 0;
239 typename SV::bvector_type_const_ptr bv2 = sv2.get_slice(i);
240 if (bv2 == bv_null2)
241 bv2 = 0;
242
243 if (!bv1)
244 {
245 if (!bv2)
246 continue;
247 bool f = bv2->find(midx);
248 if (f && (midx < mismatch))
249 {
250 found = f; sv_idx = 2; mismatch = midx;
251 }
252 continue;
253 }
254 if (!bv2)
255 {
256 BM_ASSERT(bv1);
257 bool f = bv1->find(midx);
258 if (f && (midx < mismatch))
259 {
260 found = f; sv_idx = 1; mismatch = midx;
261 }
262 continue;
263 }
264 // both planes are not NULL
265 //
266 bool f = bv1->find_first_mismatch(*bv2, midx, mismatch);
267 if (f && (midx < mismatch)) // better mismatch found
268 {
269 found = f; mismatch = midx;
270 // which vector has '1' at mismatch position?
271 if (bm::conditional<SV::is_rsc_support::value>::test())
272 sv_idx = (bv1->test(mismatch)) ? 1 : 2;
273 }
274
275 } // for i
276
277 // RSC address translation here
278 //
279 if (bm::conditional<SV::is_rsc_support::value>::test())
280 {
281 if (found) // RSC address translation
282 {
283 BM_ASSERT(sv1.is_compressed());
284 BM_ASSERT(sv2.is_compressed());
285
286 switch (sv_idx)
287 {
288 case 1:
289 found = sv1.find_rank(midx + 1, mismatch);
290 break;
291 case 2:
292 found = sv2.find_rank(midx + 1, mismatch);
293 break;
294 default: // unknown, try both
295 BM_ASSERT(0);
296 }
297 BM_ASSERT(found);
298 midx = mismatch;
299 }
300 if (null_proc == bm::use_null)
301 {
302 // no need for address translation in this case
303 bool f = bv_null1->find_first_mismatch(*bv_null2, midx, mismatch);
304 if (f && (midx < mismatch)) // better mismatch found
305 {
306 found = f; mismatch = midx;
307 }
308 }
309
310/*
311 else // search for mismatch in the NOT NULL vectors
312 {
313 if (null_proc == bm::use_null)
314 {
315 // no need for address translation in this case
316 typename SV::bvector_type_const_ptr bv_null1 = sv1.get_null_bvector();
317 typename SV::bvector_type_const_ptr bv_null2 = sv2.get_null_bvector();
318 found = bv_null1->find_first_mismatch(*bv_null2, mismatch);
319 }
320 }
321*/
322 }
323
324 midx = mismatch; // minimal mismatch
325 return found;
326}
327
328/**
329 Find mismatch vector, indicating positions of mismatch between two sparse vectors
330 (uses linear scan in bit-vector planes)
331
332 Function works with both NULL and NOT NULL vectors
333
334 @param bv - [out] - bit-ector with mismatch positions indicated as 1s
335 @param sv1 - vector 1
336 @param sv2 - vector 2
337 @param null_proc - rules of processing for (not) NULL plane
338 bm::no_null - NULLs from both vectors are treated as uncertainty
339 and NOT included into final result
340 bm::use_null - difference in NULLs accounted into the result
341
342 @sa sparse_vector_find_first_mismatch
343
344 \ingroup svalgo
345*/
346template<typename SV1, typename SV2>
347void sparse_vector_find_mismatch(typename SV1::bvector_type& bv,
348 const SV1& sv1,
349 const SV2& sv2,
350 bm::null_support null_proc)
351{
352 typedef typename SV1::bvector_type bvector_type;
353 typedef typename bvector_type::allocator_type allocator_type;
354 typedef typename allocator_type::allocator_pool_type allocator_pool_type;
355
356 allocator_pool_type pool; // local pool for blocks
357 typename bvector_type::mem_pool_guard mp_guard_bv;
358 mp_guard_bv.assign_if_not_set(pool, bv);
359
360
361 if (bm::conditional<SV1::is_rsc_support::value>::test())
362 {
363 BM_ASSERT(0); // TODO: fixme
364 }
365 if (bm::conditional<SV2::is_rsc_support::value>::test())
366 {
367 BM_ASSERT(0); // TODO: fixme
368 }
369
370 bv.clear();
371
372 unsigned planes = sv1.effective_slices();; // slices();
373 if (planes < sv2.slices())
374 planes = sv2.slices();
375
376 for (unsigned i = 0; i < planes; ++i)
377 {
378 typename SV1::bvector_type_const_ptr bv1 = sv1.get_slice(i);
379 typename SV2::bvector_type_const_ptr bv2 = sv2.get_slice(i);
380
381 if (!bv1)
382 {
383 if (!bv2)
384 continue;
385 bv |= *bv2;
386 continue;
387 }
388 if (!bv2)
389 {
390 BM_ASSERT(bv1);
391 bv |= *bv1;
392 continue;
393 }
394
395 // both planes are not NULL, compute XOR diff
396 //
397 bvector_type bv_xor;
398 typename bvector_type::mem_pool_guard mp_guard;
399 mp_guard.assign_if_not_set(pool, bv_xor);
400
401 bv_xor.bit_xor(*bv1, *bv2, SV1::bvector_type::opt_none);
402 bv |= bv_xor;
403
404 } // for i
405
406 // size mismatch check
407 {
408 typename SV1::size_type sz1 = sv1.size();
409 typename SV2::size_type sz2 = sv2.size();
410 if (sz1 != sz2)
411 {
412 if (sz1 < sz2)
413 {
414 }
415 else
416 {
417 bm::xor_swap(sz1, sz2);
418 }
419 bv.set_range(sz1, sz2-1);
420 }
421 }
422
423 // NULL processings
424 //
425 typename SV1::bvector_type_const_ptr bv_null1 = sv1.get_null_bvector();
426 typename SV2::bvector_type_const_ptr bv_null2 = sv2.get_null_bvector();
427
428 switch (null_proc)
429 {
430 case bm::no_null:
431 // NULL correction to exclude all NULL (unknown) values from the result set
432 // (AND with NOT NULL vector)
433 if (bv_null1 && bv_null2)
434 {
435 bvector_type bv_or;
436 typename bvector_type::mem_pool_guard mp_guard;
437 mp_guard.assign_if_not_set(pool, bv_or);
438
439 bv_or.bit_or(*bv_null1, *bv_null2, bvector_type::opt_none);
440 bv &= bv_or;
441 }
442 else
443 {
444 if (bv_null1)
445 bv &= *bv_null1;
446 if (bv_null2)
447 bv &= *bv_null2;
448 }
449 break;
450 case bm::use_null:
451 if (bv_null1 && bv_null2)
452 {
453 bvector_type bv_xor;
454 typename bvector_type::mem_pool_guard mp_guard;
455 mp_guard.assign_if_not_set(pool, bv_xor);
456
457 bv_xor.bit_xor(*bv_null1, *bv_null2, bvector_type::opt_none);
458 bv |= bv_xor;
459 }
460 else
461 {
462 bvector_type bv_null;
463 typename bvector_type::mem_pool_guard mp_guard;
464 mp_guard.assign_if_not_set(pool, bv_null);
465 if (bv_null1)
466 {
467 bv_null = *bv_null1;
468 bv_null.resize(sv1.size());
469 }
470 if (bv_null2)
471 {
472 bv_null = *bv_null2;
473 bv_null.resize(sv2.size());
474 }
475 bv_null.invert();
476 bv |= bv_null;
477 }
478 break;
479 default:
480 BM_ASSERT(0);
481 }
482}
483
484
485/**
486 \brief algorithms for sparse_vector scan/search
487
488 Scanner uses properties of bit-vector planes to answer questions
489 like "find all sparse vector elements equivalent to XYZ".
490
491 Class uses fast algorithms based on properties of bit-planes.
492 This is NOT a brute force, direct scan, scanner uses search space pruning and cache optimizations
493 to run the search.
494
495 @ingroup svalgo
496 @ingroup setalgo
497*/
498template<typename SV>
499class sparse_vector_scanner
500{
501public:
502 typedef typename SV::bvector_type bvector_type;
503 typedef const bvector_type* bvector_type_const_ptr;
504 typedef bvector_type* bvector_type_ptr;
505 typedef typename SV::value_type value_type;
506 typedef typename SV::size_type size_type;
507
508 typedef typename bvector_type::allocator_type allocator_type;
509 typedef typename allocator_type::allocator_pool_type allocator_pool_type;
510
511 typedef bm::aggregator<bvector_type> aggregator_type;
512 typedef
513 bm::heap_vector<value_type, typename bvector_type::allocator_type, true>
514 remap_vector_type;
515 typedef
516 bm::heap_vector<bvector_type*, allocator_type, true> bvect_vector_type;
517 typedef
518 typename aggregator_type::bv_count_vector_type bv_count_vector_type;
519
520 /**
521 Scanner options to control execution
522 */
523 typedef
524 typename aggregator_type::run_options run_options;
525
526public:
527
528
529 /**
530 Pipeline to run multiple searches against a particular SV faster using cache optimizations.
531 USAGE:
532 - setup the pipeline (add searches)
533 - run all searches at once
534 - get the search results (in the order it was added)
535 */
536 template<class Opt = bm::agg_run_options<> >
537 class pipeline
538 {
539 public:
540 typedef
541 typename aggregator_type::template pipeline<Opt> aggregator_pipeline_type;
542 public:
543 pipeline(const SV& sv)
544 : sv_(sv), bv_and_mask_(0),
545 eff_slices_(sv_.get_bmatrix().calc_effective_rows_not_null())
546 {}
547
548 /// Set pipeline run options
549 run_options& options() BMNOEXCEPT
550 { return agg_pipe_.options(); }
551
552 /// Get pipeline run options
553 const run_options& get_options() const BMNOEXCEPT
554 { return agg_pipe_.options(); }
555
556 /** Set pipeline mask bit-vector to restrict the search space
557 @param bv_mask - pointer to bit-vector restricting search to vector indexes marked
558 as 1s. Pointer ownership is not transferred, NULL value resets the mask.
559 bv_mask defines the mask for all added searches.
560
561 */
562 void set_search_mask(const bvector_type* bv_mask) BMNOEXCEPT;
563
564 /**
565 Set search limit for results. Requires that bit-counting to be enabled in the template parameters.
566 Warning: search limit is approximate (for performance reasons) so it can occasinally find more
567 than requested. It cannot find less. Search limit works for individual results (not ORed aggregate)
568 @param limit - search limit (target population count to search for)
569 */
570 void set_search_count_limit(size_type limit) BMNOEXCEPT
571 { agg_pipe_.set_search_count_limit(limit); }
572
573 /**
574 Attach OR (aggregator vector).
575 Pipeline results all will be OR-ed (UNION) into the OR target vector
576 @param bv_or - OR target vector
577 */
578 void set_or_target(bvector_type* bv_or) BMNOEXCEPT
579 { agg_pipe_.set_or_target(bv_or); }
580
581 /*! @name pipeline fill-in methods */
582 //@{
583
584 /**
585 Add new search string
586 @param str - zero terminated string pointer to configure a search for
587 */
588 void add(const typename SV::value_type* str);
589
590 /** Prepare pipeline for the execution (resize and init internal structures)
591 Once complete, you cannot add() to it.
592 */
593 void complete() { agg_pipe_.complete(); }
594
595 bool is_complete() const BMNOEXCEPT
596 { return agg_pipe_.is_complete(); }
597
598 size_type size() const BMNOEXCEPT { return agg_pipe_.size(); }
599
600 //@}
601
602 /** Return results vector used for pipeline execution */
603 bvect_vector_type& get_bv_res_vector() BMNOEXCEPT
604 { return agg_pipe_.get_bv_res_vector(); }
605 /** Return results vector count used for pipeline execution */
606
607 bv_count_vector_type& get_bv_count_vector() BMNOEXCEPT
608 { return agg_pipe_.get_bv_count_vector(); }
609
610
611 /**
612 get aggregator pipeline (access to compute internals)
613 @internal
614 */
615 aggregator_pipeline_type& get_aggregator_pipe() BMNOEXCEPT
616 { return agg_pipe_; }
617
618 protected:
619 friend class sparse_vector_scanner;
620
621 pipeline(const pipeline&) = delete;
622 pipeline& operator=(const pipeline&) = delete;
623 protected:
624 const SV& sv_; ///< target sparse vector ref
625 aggregator_pipeline_type agg_pipe_; ///< traget aggregator pipeline
626 remap_vector_type remap_value_vect_; ///< remap buffer
627 const bvector_type* bv_and_mask_;
628 size_t eff_slices_; ///< number of effectice NOT NULL value slices
629 };
630
631public:
632 sparse_vector_scanner();
633
634 /**
635 \brief bind sparse vector for all searches
636
637 \param sv - input sparse vector to bind for searches
638 \param sorted - source index is sorted, build index for binary search
639 */
640 void bind(const SV& sv, bool sorted);
641
642 /**
643 \brief reset sparse vector binding
644 */
645 void reset_binding() BMNOEXCEPT;
646
647
648 /*! @name Find in scalar vector */
649 //@{
650
651 /**
652 \brief find all sparse vector elements EQ to search value
653
654 Find all sparse vector elements equivalent to specified value
655
656 \param sv - input sparse vector
657 \param value - value to search for
658 \param bv_out - search result bit-vector (search result is a vector of 1s when sv[i] == value)
659 */
660 void find_eq(const SV& sv, value_type value, bvector_type& bv_out);
661
662 /**
663 \brief find first sparse vector element
664
665 Find all sparse vector elements equivalent to specified value.
666 Works well if sperse vector represents unordered set
667
668 \param sv - input sparse vector
669 \param value - value to search for
670 \param pos - output found sparse vector element index
671
672 \return true if found
673 */
674 bool find_eq(const SV& sv, value_type value, size_type& pos);
675
676 /**
677 \brief binary search for position in the sorted sparse vector
678
679 Method assumes the sparse array is sorted, if value is found pos returns its index,
680 if not found, pos would contain index where it could be inserted to maintain the order
681
682 \param sv - input sparse vector
683 \param val - value to search for
684 \param pos - output sparse vector element index (actual index if found or insertion
685 point if not found)
686
687 \return true if value found
688 */
689 bool bfind(const SV& sv, const value_type val, size_type& pos);
690
691 /**
692 \brief find all elements sparse vector element greater (>) than value
693
694 \param sv - input sparse vector
695 \param value - value to search for
696 \param bv_out - search result bit-vector (search result is a vector of 1s when sv[i] > value)
697 */
698 void find_gt(const SV& sv, value_type val, bvector_type& bv_out);
699
700 /**
701 \brief find all elements sparse vector element greater or equal (>=) than value
702
703 \param sv - input sparse vector
704 \param value - value to search for
705 \param bv_out - search result bit-vector (search result is a vector of 1s when sv[i] >= value)
706 */
707 void find_ge(const SV& sv, value_type val, bvector_type& bv_out);
708
709
710 /**
711 \brief find all elements sparse vector element less (<) than value
712
713 \param sv - input sparse vector
714 \param value - value to search for
715 \param bv_out - search result bit-vector (search result is a vector of 1s when sv[i] < value)
716 */
717 void find_lt(const SV& sv, value_type val, bvector_type& bv_out);
718
719 /**
720 \brief find all elements sparse vector element less or equal (<=) than value
721
722 \param sv - input sparse vector
723 \param value - value to search for
724 \param bv_out - search result bit-vector (search result is a vector of 1s when sv[i] <= value)
725 */
726 void find_le(const SV& sv, value_type val, bvector_type& bv_out);
727
728
729 /**
730 \brief find all elements sparse vector element in closed range [left..right] interval
731
732 \param sv - input sparse vector
733 \param from - range from
734 \param to - range to
735 \param bv_out - search result bit-vector (search result is a vector of 1s when sv[i] <= value)
736 */
737 void find_range(const SV& sv,
738 value_type from, value_type to,
739 bvector_type& bv_out);
740
741
742 //@}
743
744
745 // --------------------------------------------------
746 //
747 /*! @name Find in bit-transposed string vector */
748 //@{
749
750
751 /**
752 \brief find sparse vector elements (string)
753 @param sv - sparse vector of strings to search
754 @param str - string to search for
755 @param bv_out - search result bit-vector (search result masks 1 elements)
756 */
757 bool find_eq_str(const SV& sv, const value_type* str, bvector_type& bv_out);
758
759 /**
760 \brief find sparse vector elementa (string) in the attached SV
761 @param str - string to search for
762 @param bv_out - search result bit-vector (search result masks 1 elements)
763 */
764 bool find_eq_str(const value_type* str, bvector_type& bv_out);
765
766 /**
767 \brief find first sparse vector element (string)
768 @param sv - sparse vector of strings to search
769 @param str - string to search for
770 @param pos - [out] index of the first found
771 */
772 bool find_eq_str(const SV& sv, const value_type* str, size_type& pos);
773
774 /**
775 \brief binary find first sparse vector element (string)
776 Sparse vector must be attached (bind())
777 @param str - string to search for
778 @param pos - [out] index of the first found
779 @sa bind
780 */
781 bool find_eq_str(const value_type* str, size_type& pos);
782
783 /**
784 \brief find sparse vector elements with a given prefix (string)
785 @param sv - sparse vector of strings to search
786 @param str - string prefix to search for
787 "123" is a prefix for "1234567"
788 @param bv_out - search result bit-vector (search result masks 1 elements)
789 */
790 bool find_eq_str_prefix(const SV& sv, const value_type* str,
791 bvector_type& bv_out);
792
793 /**
794 \brief find sparse vector elements using search pipeline
795 @param pipe - pipeline to run
796 */
797 template<class TPipe>
798 void find_eq_str(TPipe& pipe);
799
800 /**
801 \brief binary find first sparse vector element (string)
802 Sparse vector must be sorted.
803 */
804 bool bfind_eq_str(const SV& sv,
805 const value_type* str, size_type& pos);
806
807 /**
808 \brief lower bound search for an array position
809
810 Method assumes the sparse array is sorted
811
812 \param sv - input sparse vector
813 \param str - value to search for
814 \param pos - output sparse vector element index
815
816 \return true if value found
817 */
818 bool lower_bound_str(const SV& sv,
819 const value_type* str,
820 size_type& pos);
821
822 /**
823 \brief binary find first sparse vector element (string)
824 Sparse vector must be sorted and attached
825 @sa bind
826 */
827 bool bfind_eq_str(const value_type* str, size_type& pos);
828
829 //@}
830
831 /**
832 \brief find all sparse vector elements EQ to 0
833 \param sv - input sparse vector
834 \param bv_out - output bit-vector (search result masks 1 elements)
835 \param null_correct - flag to perform NULL correction
836 */
837 void find_zero(const SV& sv, bvector_type& bv_out, bool null_correct = true);
838
839 /*!
840 \brief Find non-zero elements
841 Output vector is computed as a logical OR (join) of all planes
842
843 \param sv - input sparse vector
844 \param bv_out - output bit-bector of non-zero elements
845 */
846 void find_nonzero(const SV& sv, bvector_type& bv_out);
847
848 /*!
849 \brief Find positive (greter than zero elements)
850 Output vector is computed as a logical OR (join) of all planes
851
852 \param sv - input sparse vector
853 \param bv_out - output bit-bector of non-zero elements
854 */
855 void find_positive(const SV& sv, bvector_type& bv_out);
856
857
858 /**
859 \brief invert search result ("EQ" to "not EQ")
860
861 \param sv - input sparse vector
862 \param bv_out - output bit-bector of non-zero elements
863 */
864 void invert(const SV& sv, bvector_type& bv_out);
865
866 /**
867 \brief find all values A IN (C, D, E, F)
868 \param sv - input sparse vector
869 \param start - start iterator (set to search)
870 \param end - end iterator (set to search)
871 \param bv_out - output bit-bector of non-zero elements
872 */
873 template<typename It>
874 void find_eq(const SV& sv,
875 It start,
876 It end,
877 bvector_type& bv_out)
878 {
879 typename bvector_type::mem_pool_guard mp_guard;
880 mp_guard.assign_if_not_set(pool_, bv_out); // set algorithm-local memory pool to avoid heap contention
881
882 bvector_type bv1;
883 typename bvector_type::mem_pool_guard mp_guard1(pool_, bv1);
884 bool any_zero = false;
885 for (; start < end; ++start)
886 {
887 value_type v = *start;
888 any_zero |= (v == 0);
889 bool found = find_eq_with_nulls(sv, v, bv1);
890 if (found)
891 bv_out.bit_or(bv1);
892 else
893 {
894 BM_ASSERT(!bv1.any());
895 }
896 } // for
897 if (any_zero)
898 correct_nulls(sv, bv_out);
899 }
900
901
902 /// For testing purposes only
903 ///
904 /// @internal
905 void find_eq_with_nulls_horizontal(const SV& sv, value_type value,
906 bvector_type& bv_out);
907
908 /// For testing purposes only
909 ///
910 /// @internal
911 void find_gt_horizontal(const SV& sv,
912 value_type value,
913 bvector_type& bv_out,
914 bool null_correct = true);
915
916
917 /** Exclude possible NULL values from the result vector
918 \param sv - input sparse vector
919 \param bv_out - output bit-bector of non-zero elements
920 */
921 void correct_nulls(const SV& sv, bvector_type& bv_out);
922
923 /// Return allocator pool for blocks
924 /// (Can be used to improve performance of repeated searches with the same scanner)
925 ///
926 allocator_pool_type& get_bvector_alloc_pool() BMNOEXCEPT { return pool_; }
927
928protected:
929
930 /// Remap input value into SV char encodings
931 static
932 bool remap_tosv(remap_vector_type& remap_vect_target,
933 const value_type* str,
934 const SV& sv);
935
936 /// set search boundaries (hint for the aggregator)
937 void set_search_range(size_type from, size_type to);
938
939 /// reset (disable) search range
940 void reset_search_range();
941
942 /// find value (may include NULL indexes)
943 bool find_eq_with_nulls(const SV& sv,
944 value_type value,
945 bvector_type& bv_out,
946 size_type search_limit = 0);
947
948 /// find first value (may include NULL indexes)
949 bool find_first_eq(const SV& sv,
950 value_type value,
951 size_type& idx);
952
953 /// find first string value (may include NULL indexes)
954 bool find_first_eq(const SV& sv,
955 const value_type* str,
956 size_type& idx,
957 bool remaped);
958
959 /// find EQ str / prefix impl
960 bool find_eq_str_impl(const SV& sv,
961 const value_type* str,
962 bvector_type& bv_out,
963 bool prefix_sub);
964
965 /// Prepare aggregator for AND-SUB (EQ) search
966 bool prepare_and_sub_aggregator(const SV& sv, value_type value);
967
968 /// Prepare aggregator for AND-SUB (EQ) search (string)
969 bool prepare_and_sub_aggregator(const SV& sv,
970 const value_type* str,
971 unsigned octet_start,
972 bool prefix_sub);
973
974 /// Rank-Select decompression for RSC vectors
975 void decompress(const SV& sv, bvector_type& bv_out);
976
977 /// compare sv[idx] with input str
978 int compare_str(const SV& sv, size_type idx, const value_type* str);
979
980 /// compare sv[idx] with input value
981 int compare(const SV& sv, size_type idx, const value_type val) BMNOEXCEPT;
982
983 /// @internal
984 void aggregate_OR_slices(bvector_type& bv_target, const SV& sv,
985 unsigned from, unsigned total_planes);
986
987 /// @internal
988 static
989 void aggregate_AND_OR_slices(bvector_type& bv_target,
990 const bvector_type& bv_mask,
991 const SV& sv,
992 unsigned from, unsigned total_planes);
993
994 /// Return the slice limit for signed/unsigned vector value types
995 /// @internal
996 static constexpr int gt_slice_limit() noexcept
997 {
998 if constexpr (std::is_signed<value_type>::value)
999 return 1; // last plane
1000 else
1001 return 0;
1002 }
1003
1004
1005protected:
1006 sparse_vector_scanner(const sparse_vector_scanner&) = delete;
1007 void operator=(const sparse_vector_scanner&) = delete;
1008
1009protected:
1010 enum search_algo_params
1011 {
1012 linear_cutoff1 = 16,
1013 linear_cutoff2 = 128
1014 };
1015
1016 typedef bm::dynamic_heap_matrix<value_type, allocator_type> heap_matrix_type;
1017 typedef bm::dynamic_heap_matrix<value_type, allocator_type> matrix_search_buf_type;
1018
1019 typedef
1020 bm::heap_vector<bm::id64_t, typename bvector_type::allocator_type, true>
1021 mask_vector_type;
1022
1023protected:
1024
1025 /// Addd char to aggregator (AND-SUB)
1026 template<typename AGG>
1027 static
1028 void add_agg_char(AGG& agg,
1029 const SV& sv,
1030 int octet_idx, bm::id64_t planes_mask,
1031 unsigned value)
1032 {
1033 unsigned char bits[64];
1034 unsigned short bit_count_v = bm::bitscan(value, bits);
1035 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bit_count_v; ++i)
1036 {
1037 unsigned bit_idx = bits[i];
1038 BM_ASSERT(value & (value_type(1) << bit_idx));
1039 unsigned plane_idx = (unsigned(octet_idx) * 8) + bit_idx;
1040 const bvector_type* bv = sv.get_slice(plane_idx);
1041 BM_ASSERT(bv != sv.get_null_bvector());
1042 agg.add(bv, 0); // add to the AND group
1043 } // for i
1044 unsigned vinv = unsigned(value);
1045 if constexpr (sizeof(value_type) == 1)
1046 vinv ^= 0xFF;
1047 else // 2-byte char
1048 {
1049 BM_ASSERT(sizeof(value_type) == 2);
1050 vinv ^= 0xFFFF;
1051 }
1052 // exclude the octet bits which are all not set (no vectors)
1053 vinv &= unsigned(planes_mask);
1054 for (unsigned octet_plane = (unsigned(octet_idx) * 8); vinv; vinv &= vinv-1)
1055 {
1056 bm::id_t t = vinv & -vinv;
1057 unsigned bit_idx = bm::word_bitcount(t - 1);
1058 unsigned plane_idx = octet_plane + bit_idx;
1059 const bvector_type* bv = sv.get_slice(plane_idx);
1060 BM_ASSERT(bv);
1061 BM_ASSERT(bv != sv.get_null_bvector());
1062 agg.add(bv, 1); // add to SUB group
1063 } // for
1064 }
1065
1066private:
1067 allocator_pool_type pool_;
1068 bvector_type bv_tmp_;
1069 aggregator_type agg_;
1070 bm::rank_compressor<bvector_type> rank_compr_;
1071
1072 size_type mask_from_;
1073 size_type mask_to_;
1074 bool mask_set_;
1075
1076 const SV* bound_sv_;
1077 heap_matrix_type block0_elements_cache_; ///< cache for elements[0] of each block
1078 heap_matrix_type block3_elements_cache_; ///< cache for elements[16384x] of each block
1079 size_type effective_str_max_;
1080
1081 remap_vector_type remap_value_vect_; ///< remap buffer
1082 /// masks of allocated bit-planes (1 - means there is a bit-plane)
1083 mask_vector_type vector_plane_masks_;
1084 matrix_search_buf_type hmatr_; ///< heap matrix for string search linear stage
1085};
1086
1087
1088/*!
1089 \brief Integer set to set transformation (functional image in groups theory)
1090 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image_(mathematics)
1091
1092 Input sets gets translated through the function, which is defined as
1093 "one to one (or NULL)" binary relation object (sparse_vector).
1094 Also works for M:1 relationships.
1095
1096 \ingroup svalgo
1097 \ingroup setalgo
1098*/
1099template<typename SV>
1100class set2set_11_transform
1101{
1102public:
1103 typedef typename SV::bvector_type bvector_type;
1104 typedef typename SV::value_type value_type;
1105 typedef typename SV::size_type size_type;
1106 typedef typename bvector_type::allocator_type::allocator_pool_type allocator_pool_type;
1107public:
1108
1109 set2set_11_transform();
1110 ~set2set_11_transform();
1111
1112
1113 /** Get read access to zero-elements vector
1114 Zero vector gets populated after attach_sv() is called
1115 or as a side-effect of remap() with immediate sv param
1116 */
1117 const bvector_type& get_bv_zero() const { return bv_zero_; }
1118
1119 /** Perform remapping (Image function) (based on attached translation table)
1120
1121 \param bv_in - input set, defined as a bit-vector
1122 \param bv_out - output set as a bit-vector
1123
1124 @sa attach_sv
1125 */
1126 void remap(const bvector_type& bv_in,
1127 bvector_type& bv_out);
1128
1129 /** Perform remapping (Image function)
1130
1131 \param bv_in - input set, defined as a bit-vector
1132 \param sv_brel - binary relation (translation table) sparse vector
1133 \param bv_out - output set as a bit-vector
1134 */
1135 void remap(const bvector_type& bv_in,
1136 const SV& sv_brel,
1137 bvector_type& bv_out);
1138
1139 /** Remap single set element
1140
1141 \param id_from - input value
1142 \param sv_brel - translation table sparse vector
1143 \param id_to - out value
1144
1145 \return - true if value was found and remapped
1146 */
1147 bool remap(size_type id_from, const SV& sv_brel, size_type& id_to);
1148
1149
1150 /** Run remap transformation
1151
1152 \param bv_in - input set, defined as a bit-vector
1153 \param sv_brel - translation table sparse vector
1154 \param bv_out - output set as a bit-vector
1155
1156 @sa remap
1157 */
1158 void run(const bvector_type& bv_in,
1159 const SV& sv_brel,
1160 bvector_type& bv_out)
1161 {
1162 remap(bv_in, sv_brel, bv_out);
1163 }
1164
1165 /** Attach a translation table vector for remapping (Image function)
1166
1167 \param sv_brel - binary relation sparse vector pointer
1168 (pass NULL to detach)
1169 \param compute_stats - flag to perform computation of some statistics
1170 later used in remapping. This only make sense
1171 for series of remappings on the same translation
1172 vector.
1173 @sa remap
1174 */
1175 void attach_sv(const SV* sv_brel, bool compute_stats = false);
1176
1177
1178protected:
1179 void one_pass_run(const bvector_type& bv_in,
1180 const SV& sv_brel,
1181 bvector_type& bv_out);
1182
1183 /// @internal
1184 template<unsigned BSIZE>
1185 struct gather_buffer
1186 {
1187 size_type BM_VECT_ALIGN gather_idx_[BSIZE] BM_VECT_ALIGN_ATTR;
1188 value_type BM_VECT_ALIGN buffer_[BSIZE] BM_VECT_ALIGN_ATTR;
1189 };
1190
1191 enum gather_window_size
1192 {
1193 sv_g_size = 1024 * 8
1194 };
1195 typedef gather_buffer<sv_g_size> gather_buffer_type;
1196
1197
1198protected:
1199 set2set_11_transform(const set2set_11_transform&) = delete;
1200 void operator=(const set2set_11_transform&) = delete;
1201
1202protected:
1203 const SV* sv_ptr_; ///< current translation table vector
1204 gather_buffer_type* gb_; ///< intermediate buffers
1205 bvector_type bv_product_;///< temp vector
1206
1207 bool have_stats_; ///< flag of statistics presense
1208 bvector_type bv_zero_; ///< bit-vector for zero elements
1209
1210 allocator_pool_type pool_;
1211};
1212
1213
1214
1215//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1216//
1217//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1218
1219template<typename SV>
1220set2set_11_transform<SV>::set2set_11_transform()
1221: sv_ptr_(0), gb_(0), have_stats_(false)
1222{
1223 // set2set_11_transform for signed int is not implemented yet
1224 static_assert(std::is_unsigned<value_type>::value,
1225 "BM: unsigned sparse vector is required for transform");
1226 gb_ = (gather_buffer_type*)::malloc(sizeof(gather_buffer_type));
1227 if (!gb_)
1228 {
1229 SV::throw_bad_alloc();
1230 }
1231}
1232
1233//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1234
1235template<typename SV>
1236set2set_11_transform<SV>::~set2set_11_transform()
1237{
1238 if (gb_)
1239 ::free(gb_);
1240}
1241
1242
1243//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1244
1245template<typename SV>
1246void set2set_11_transform<SV>::attach_sv(const SV* sv_brel, bool compute_stats)
1247{
1248 sv_ptr_ = sv_brel;
1249 if (!sv_ptr_)
1250 {
1251 have_stats_ = false;
1252 }
1253 else
1254 {
1255 if (sv_brel->empty() || !compute_stats)
1256 return; // nothing to do
1257 const bvector_type* bv_non_null = sv_brel->get_null_bvector();
1258 if (bv_non_null)
1259 return; // already have 0 elements vector
1260
1261
1262 typename bvector_type::mem_pool_guard mp_g_z;
1263 mp_g_z.assign_if_not_set(pool_, bv_zero_);
1264
1265 bm::sparse_vector_scanner<SV> scanner;
1266 scanner.find_zero(*sv_brel, bv_zero_);
1267 have_stats_ = true;
1268 }
1269}
1270
1271//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1272
1273template<typename SV>
1274bool set2set_11_transform<SV>::remap(size_type id_from,
1275 const SV& sv_brel,
1276 size_type& id_to)
1277{
1278 if (sv_brel.empty())
1279 return false; // nothing to do
1280
1281 const bvector_type* bv_non_null = sv_brel.get_null_bvector();
1282 if (bv_non_null)
1283 {
1284 if (!bv_non_null->test(id_from))
1285 return false;
1286 }
1287 size_type idx = sv_brel.translate_address(id_from);
1288 id_to = sv_brel.get(idx);
1289 return true;
1290}
1291
1292//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1293
1294template<typename SV>
1295void set2set_11_transform<SV>::remap(const bvector_type& bv_in,
1296 const SV& sv_brel,
1297 bvector_type& bv_out)
1298{
1299 typename bvector_type::mem_pool_guard mp_g_out, mp_g_p, mp_g_z;
1300 mp_g_out.assign_if_not_set(pool_, bv_out);
1301 mp_g_p.assign_if_not_set(pool_, bv_product_);
1302 mp_g_z.assign_if_not_set(pool_, bv_zero_);
1303
1304 attach_sv(&sv_brel);
1305
1306 remap(bv_in, bv_out);
1307
1308 attach_sv(0); // detach translation table
1309}
1310
1311template<typename SV>
1312void set2set_11_transform<SV>::remap(const bvector_type& bv_in,
1313 bvector_type& bv_out)
1314{
1315 BM_ASSERT(sv_ptr_);
1316
1317 bv_out.clear();
1318
1319 if (sv_ptr_ == 0 || sv_ptr_->empty())
1320 return; // nothing to do
1321
1322 bv_out.init(); // just in case to "fast set" later
1323
1324 typename bvector_type::mem_pool_guard mp_g_out, mp_g_p, mp_g_z;
1325 mp_g_out.assign_if_not_set(pool_, bv_out);
1326 mp_g_p.assign_if_not_set(pool_, bv_product_);
1327 mp_g_z.assign_if_not_set(pool_, bv_zero_);
1328
1329
1330 const bvector_type* enum_bv;
1331
1332 const bvector_type * bv_non_null = sv_ptr_->get_null_bvector();
1333 if (bv_non_null)
1334 {
1335 // TODO: optimize with 2-way ops
1336 bv_product_ = bv_in;
1337 bv_product_.bit_and(*bv_non_null);
1338 enum_bv = &bv_product_;
1339 }
1340 else // non-NULL vector is not available
1341 {
1342 enum_bv = &bv_in;
1343 // if we have any elements mapping into "0" on the other end
1344 // we map it once (chances are there are many duplicates)
1345 //
1346
1347 if (have_stats_) // pre-attached translation statistics
1348 {
1349 bv_product_ = bv_in;
1350 size_type cnt1 = bv_product_.count();
1351 bv_product_.bit_sub(bv_zero_);
1352 size_type cnt2 = bv_product_.count();
1353
1354 BM_ASSERT(cnt2 <= cnt1);
1355
1356 if (cnt1 != cnt2) // mapping included 0 elements
1357 bv_out.set_bit_no_check(0);
1358
1359 enum_bv = &bv_product_;
1360 }
1361 }
1362
1363
1364
1365 size_type buf_cnt, nb_old, nb;
1366 buf_cnt = nb_old = 0;
1367
1368 typename bvector_type::enumerator en(enum_bv->first());
1369 for (; en.valid(); ++en)
1370 {
1371 typename SV::size_type idx = *en;
1372 idx = sv_ptr_->translate_address(idx);
1373
1374 nb = unsigned(idx >> bm::set_block_shift);
1375 if (nb != nb_old) // new blocks
1376 {
1377 if (buf_cnt)
1378 {
1379 sv_ptr_->gather(&gb_->buffer_[0], &gb_->gather_idx_[0], buf_cnt, BM_SORTED_UNIFORM);
1380 bv_out.set(&gb_->buffer_[0], buf_cnt, BM_SORTED);
1381 buf_cnt = 0;
1382 }
1383 nb_old = nb;
1384 gb_->gather_idx_[buf_cnt++] = idx;
1385 }
1386 else
1387 {
1388 gb_->gather_idx_[buf_cnt++] = idx;
1389 }
1390
1391 if (buf_cnt == sv_g_size)
1392 {
1393 sv_ptr_->gather(&gb_->buffer_[0], &gb_->gather_idx_[0], buf_cnt, BM_SORTED_UNIFORM);
1394 bv_out.set(&gb_->buffer_[0], buf_cnt, bm::BM_SORTED);
1395 buf_cnt = 0;
1396 }
1397 } // for en
1398 if (buf_cnt)
1399 {
1400 sv_ptr_->gather(&gb_->buffer_[0], &gb_->gather_idx_[0], buf_cnt, BM_SORTED_UNIFORM);
1401 bv_out.set(&gb_->buffer_[0], buf_cnt, bm::BM_SORTED);
1402 }
1403}
1404
1405
1406//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1407
1408template<typename SV>
1409void set2set_11_transform<SV>::one_pass_run(const bvector_type& bv_in,
1410 const SV& sv_brel,
1411 bvector_type& bv_out)
1412{
1413 if (sv_brel.empty())
1414 return; // nothing to do
1415
1416 bv_out.init();
1417
1418 typename SV::const_iterator it = sv_brel.begin();
1419 for (; it.valid(); ++it)
1420 {
1421 typename SV::value_type t_id = *it;
1422 size_type idx = it.pos();
1423 if (bv_in.test(idx))
1424 {
1425 bv_out.set_bit_no_check(t_id);
1426 }
1427 } // for
1428}
1429
1430
1431//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1432//
1433//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1434
1435template<typename SV>
1436sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::sparse_vector_scanner()
1437{
1438 mask_set_ = false;
1439 mask_from_ = mask_to_ = bm::id_max;
1440
1441 bound_sv_ = 0;
1442 effective_str_max_ = 0;
1443}
1444
1445//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1446
1447template<typename SV>
1448void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::bind(const SV& sv, bool sorted)
1449{
1450 (void)sorted; // MSVC warning over if constexpr variable "not-referenced"
1451 bound_sv_ = &sv;
1452
1453 if constexpr (SV::is_str()) // bindings for the string sparse vector
1454 {
1455 effective_str_max_ = sv.effective_vector_max();
1456 if (sorted)
1457 {
1458 size_type sv_sz = sv.size();
1459 BM_ASSERT(sv_sz);
1460 size_type total_nb = sv_sz / bm::gap_max_bits + 1;
1461
1462 block0_elements_cache_.resize(total_nb, effective_str_max_+1);
1463 block0_elements_cache_.set_zero();
1464
1465 block3_elements_cache_.resize(total_nb * 3, effective_str_max_+1);
1466 block3_elements_cache_.set_zero();
1467
1468 // fill in elements cache
1469 for (size_type i = 0; i < sv_sz; i+= bm::gap_max_bits)
1470 {
1471 size_type nb = (i >> bm::set_block_shift);
1472 value_type* s0 = block0_elements_cache_.row(nb);
1473 sv.get(i, s0, size_type(block0_elements_cache_.cols()));
1474
1475 for (size_type k = 0; k < 3; ++k)
1476 {
1477 value_type* s1 = block3_elements_cache_.row(nb * 3 + k);
1478 size_type idx = i + (k+1) * bm::sub_block3_size;
1479 sv.get(idx, s1, size_type(block3_elements_cache_.cols()));
1480 } // for k
1481 } // for i
1482 }
1483 // pre-calculate vector plane masks
1484 //
1485 vector_plane_masks_.resize(effective_str_max_);
1486 for (unsigned i = 0; i < effective_str_max_; ++i)
1487 {
1488 vector_plane_masks_[i] = sv.get_slice_mask(i);
1489 } // for i
1490 }
1491}
1492
1493//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1494
1495template<typename SV>
1496void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::reset_binding() BMNOEXCEPT
1497{
1498 bound_sv_ = 0;
1499 effective_str_max_ = 0;
1500}
1501
1502//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1503
1504template<typename SV>
1505void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_zero(const SV& sv,
1506 bvector_type& bv_out,
1507 bool null_correct)
1508{
1509 if (sv.size() == 0)
1510 {
1511 bv_out.clear();
1512 return;
1513 }
1514 find_nonzero(sv, bv_out);
1515 if constexpr (SV::is_compressed())
1516 {
1517 bv_out.invert();
1518 bv_out.set_range(sv.effective_size(), bm::id_max - 1, false);
1519 decompress(sv, bv_out);
1520 }
1521 else
1522 {
1523 invert(sv, bv_out);
1524 }
1525 if (null_correct)
1526 correct_nulls(sv, bv_out);
1527}
1528
1529//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1530
1531template<typename SV>
1532void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::invert(const SV& sv, bvector_type& bv_out)
1533{
1534 if (sv.size() == 0)
1535 {
1536 bv_out.clear();
1537 return;
1538 }
1539 // TODO: find a better algorithm (NAND?)
1540 auto old_sz = bv_out.size();
1541 bv_out.resize(sv.size());
1542 bv_out.invert();
1543 bv_out.resize(old_sz);
1544 correct_nulls(sv, bv_out);
1545 /*
1546 bv_out.invert();
1547 const bvector_type* bv_null = sv.get_null_bvector();
1548 if (bv_null) // correct result to only use not NULL elements
1549 bv_out &= *bv_null;
1550 else
1551 {
1552 // TODO: use the shorter range to clear the tail
1553 bv_out.set_range(sv.size(), bm::id_max - 1, false);
1554 }
1555 */
1556}
1557
1558//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1559
1560template<typename SV>
1561void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::correct_nulls(const SV& sv,
1562 bvector_type& bv_out)
1563{
1564 const bvector_type* bv_null = sv.get_null_bvector();
1565 if (bv_null) // correct result to only use not NULL elements
1566 bv_out.bit_and(*bv_null);
1567}
1568
1569//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1570
1571template<typename SV>
1572bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_eq_with_nulls(const SV& sv,
1573 value_type value,
1574 bvector_type& bv_out,
1575 size_type search_limit)
1576{
1577 if (sv.empty())
1578 return false; // nothing to do
1579
1580 if (!value)
1581 {
1582 find_zero(sv, bv_out);
1583 return bv_out.any();
1584 }
1585 agg_.reset();
1586
1587 bool found = prepare_and_sub_aggregator(sv, value);
1588 if (!found)
1589 {
1590 bv_out.clear();
1591 return found;
1592 }
1593
1594 bool any = (search_limit == 1);
1595 found = agg_.combine_and_sub(bv_out, any);
1596 agg_.reset();
1597 return found;
1598}
1599
1600//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1601
1602template<typename SV>
1603bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_first_eq(const SV& sv,
1604 value_type value,
1605 size_type& idx)
1606{
1607 if (sv.empty())
1608 return false; // nothing to do
1609
1610 BM_ASSERT(value); // cannot handle zero values
1611 if (!value)
1612 return false;
1613
1614 agg_.reset();
1615 bool found = prepare_and_sub_aggregator(sv, value);
1616 if (!found)
1617 return found;
1618 found = agg_.find_first_and_sub(idx);
1619 agg_.reset();
1620 return found;
1621}
1622
1623
1624//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1625
1626template<typename SV>
1627bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_first_eq(
1628 const SV& sv,
1629 const value_type* str,
1630 size_type& idx,
1631 bool remaped)
1632{
1633 if (sv.empty())
1634 return false; // nothing to do
1635 BM_ASSERT(*str);
1636
1637 if (!*str)
1638 return false;
1639
1640 agg_.reset();
1641 unsigned common_prefix_len = 0;
1642 if (mask_set_)
1643 {
1644 agg_.set_range_hint(mask_from_, mask_to_);
1645 common_prefix_len = sv.common_prefix_length(mask_from_, mask_to_);
1646 }
1647
1648 if (remaped)
1649 {
1650 str = remap_value_vect_.data();
1651 }
1652 else
1653 {
1654 if (sv.is_remap() && (str != remap_value_vect_.data()))
1655 {
1656 bool r = sv.remap_tosv(
1657 remap_value_vect_.data(), sv.effective_max_str(), str);
1658 if (!r)
1659 return r;
1660 str = remap_value_vect_.data();
1661 }
1662 }
1663
1664 bool found = prepare_and_sub_aggregator(sv, str, common_prefix_len, true);
1665 if (!found)
1666 return found;
1667
1668 found = agg_.find_first_and_sub(idx);
1669 agg_.reset();
1670 return found;
1671}
1672
1673//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1674
1675template<typename SV>
1676bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::prepare_and_sub_aggregator(const SV& sv,
1677 const value_type* str,
1678 unsigned octet_start,
1679 bool prefix_sub)
1680{
1681 int len = 0;
1682 for (; str[len] != 0; ++len)
1683 {}
1684 BM_ASSERT(len);
1685
1686 // use reverse order (faster for sorted arrays)
1687 for (int octet_idx = len-1; octet_idx >= 0; --octet_idx)
1688 {
1689 if (unsigned(octet_idx) < octet_start) // common prefix
1690 break;
1691
1692 unsigned value = unsigned(str[octet_idx]) & 0xFF;
1693 BM_ASSERT(value != 0);
1694
1695 bm::id64_t planes_mask;
1696 if (&sv == bound_sv_)
1697 planes_mask = vector_plane_masks_[unsigned(octet_idx)];
1698 else
1699 planes_mask = sv.get_slice_mask(unsigned(octet_idx));
1700
1701 if ((value & planes_mask) != value) // pre-screen for impossible values
1702 return false; // found non-existing plane
1703
1704 add_agg_char(agg_, sv, octet_idx, planes_mask, value); // AND-SUB aggregator
1705 } // for octet_idx
1706
1707 // add all vectors above string len to the SUB aggregation group
1708 //
1709 if (prefix_sub)
1710 {
1711 unsigned plane_idx = unsigned(len * 8);
1712 typename SV::size_type planes = sv.get_bmatrix().rows_not_null();
1713 for (; plane_idx < planes; ++plane_idx)
1714 {
1715 if (bvector_type_const_ptr bv = sv.get_slice(plane_idx))
1716 agg_.add(bv, 1); // agg to SUB group
1717 } // for
1718 }
1719 return true;
1720}
1721
1722//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1723
1724template<typename SV>
1725bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::prepare_and_sub_aggregator(const SV& sv,
1726 value_type value)
1727{
1728 using unsigned_value_type = typename SV::unsigned_value_type;
1729
1730 agg_.reset();
1731
1732 unsigned char bits[sizeof(value) * 8];
1733 unsigned_value_type uv = sv.s2u(value);
1734
1735 unsigned short bit_count_v = bm::bitscan(uv, bits);
1736 BM_ASSERT(bit_count_v);
1737 const unsigned_value_type mask1 = 1;
1738
1739 // prep the lists for combined AND-SUB aggregator
1740 // (backward order has better chance for bit reduction on AND)
1741 //
1742 for (unsigned i = bit_count_v; i > 0; --i)
1743 {
1744 unsigned bit_idx = bits[i-1];
1745 BM_ASSERT(uv & (mask1 << bit_idx));
1746 if (const bvector_type* bv = sv.get_slice(bit_idx))
1747 agg_.add(bv);
1748 else
1749 return false;
1750 }
1751 unsigned sv_planes = sv.effective_slices();
1752 for (unsigned i = 0; i < sv_planes; ++i)
1753 {
1754 unsigned_value_type mask = mask1 << i;
1755 if (bvector_type_const_ptr bv = sv.get_slice(i); bv && !(uv & mask))
1756 agg_.add(bv, 1); // agg to SUB group
1757 } // for i
1758 return true;
1759}
1760
1761
1762//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1763
1764template<typename SV>
1765void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_eq_with_nulls_horizontal(
1766 const SV& sv,
1767 value_type value,
1768 bvector_type& bv_out)
1769{
1770 bv_out.clear();
1771 if (sv.empty())
1772 return; // nothing to do
1773
1774 if (!value)
1775 {
1776 find_zero(sv, bv_out);
1777 return;
1778 }
1779
1780 unsigned char bits[sizeof(value) * 8];
1781 typename SV::unsigned_value_type uv = sv.s2u(value);
1782 unsigned short bit_count_v = bm::bitscan(uv, bits);
1783 BM_ASSERT(bit_count_v);
1784
1785 // aggregate AND all matching vectors
1786 if (const bvector_type* bv_plane = sv.get_slice(bits[--bit_count_v]))
1787 bv_out = *bv_plane;
1788 else // plane not found
1789 {
1790 bv_out.clear();
1791 return;
1792 }
1793 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bit_count_v; ++i)
1794 {
1795 const bvector_type* bv_plane = sv.get_slice(bits[i]);
1796 if (bv_plane)
1797 bv_out &= *bv_plane;
1798 else // mandatory plane not found - empty result!
1799 {
1800 bv_out.clear();
1801 return;
1802 }
1803 } // for i
1804
1805 // SUB all other planes
1806 unsigned sv_planes = sv.effective_slices();
1807 for (unsigned i = 0; (i < sv_planes) && uv; ++i)
1808 {
1809 if (const bvector_type* bv = sv.get_slice(i); bv && !(uv & (1u << i)))
1810 bv_out -= *bv;
1811 } // for i
1812}
1813
1814//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1815
1816template<typename SV>
1817void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_gt(const SV& sv,
1818 value_type val,
1819 bvector_type& bv_out)
1820{
1821 // this is not very optimal but should be good enough
1822 find_gt_horizontal(sv, val, bv_out, true /*NULL correction */);
1823}
1824
1825//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1826
1827template<typename SV>
1828void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_ge(const SV& sv,
1829 value_type val,
1830 bvector_type& bv_out)
1831{
1832 if constexpr (std::is_signed<value_type>::value)
1833 {
1834 if (val == std::numeric_limits<int>::min())
1835 {
1836 bvector_type bv_min;
1837 find_eq(sv, val, bv_min);
1838 find_gt_horizontal(sv, val, bv_out, true /*NULL correction */);
1839 bv_out.merge(bv_min);
1840 }
1841 else
1842 {
1843 --val;
1844 find_gt_horizontal(sv, val, bv_out, true /*NULL correction */);
1845 }
1846 }
1847 else // unsigned
1848 {
1849 if (val)
1850 {
1851 --val;
1852 find_gt_horizontal(sv, val, bv_out, true /*NULL correction */);
1853 }
1854 else // val == 0
1855 {
1856 // result set is ALL elements minus possible NULL values
1857 bv_out.set_range(0, sv.size()-1);
1858 correct_nulls(sv, bv_out);
1859 }
1860 }
1861}
1862
1863//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1864
1865template<typename SV>
1866void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_lt(const SV& sv,
1867 value_type val,
1868 bvector_type& bv_out)
1869{
1870 find_ge(sv, val, bv_out);
1871 invert(sv, bv_out);
1872}
1873
1874//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1875
1876template<typename SV>
1877void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_le(const SV& sv,
1878 value_type val,
1879 bvector_type& bv_out)
1880{
1881 find_gt(sv, val, bv_out);
1882 invert(sv, bv_out);
1883}
1884
1885//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1886
1887template<typename SV>
1888void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_range(const SV& sv,
1889 value_type from, value_type to,
1890 bvector_type& bv_out)
1891{
1892 if (to < from)
1893 bm::xor_swap(from, to);
1894
1895 find_ge(sv, from, bv_out);
1896
1897 bvector_type bv_gt;
1898 find_gt(sv, to, bv_gt);
1899 bv_out.bit_sub(bv_gt);
1900}
1901
1902//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1903
1904
1905template<typename SV>
1906void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_gt_horizontal(const SV& sv,
1907 value_type value,
1908 bvector_type& bv_out,
1909 bool null_correct)
1910{
1911 unsigned char blist[64];
1912 unsigned bit_count_v;
1913
1914 if (sv.empty())
1915 {
1916 bv_out.clear();
1917 return; // nothing to do
1918 }
1919
1920 if (!value)
1921 {
1922 bvector_type bv_zero;
1923 find_zero(sv, bv_zero);
1924 auto sz = sv.size();
1925 bv_out.set_range(0, sz-1);
1926 bv_out.bit_sub(bv_zero); // all but zero
1927
1928 if constexpr (std::is_signed<value_type>::value)
1929 {
1930 if (const bvector_type* bv_sign = sv.get_slice(0)) // sign bvector
1931 bv_out.bit_sub(*bv_sign); // all but negatives
1932 }
1933 if (null_correct)
1934 correct_nulls(sv, bv_out);
1935 return;
1936 }
1937 bv_out.clear();
1938
1939 bvector_type gtz_bv; // all >= 0
1940
1941 if constexpr (std::is_signed<value_type>::value)
1942 {
1943 find_positive(sv, gtz_bv); // all positives are greater than all negs
1944 if (value == -1)
1945 {
1946 bv_out.swap(gtz_bv);
1947 if (null_correct)
1948 correct_nulls(sv, bv_out);
1949 return;
1950 }
1951 if (value == -2)
1952 {
1953 find_eq(sv, -1, bv_out);
1954 bv_out.bit_or(gtz_bv);
1955 if (null_correct)
1956 correct_nulls(sv, bv_out);
1957 return;
1958 }
1959
1960 auto uvalue = SV::s2u(value + bool(value < 0)); // turns it int LE expression
1961 uvalue &= ~1u; // drop the negative bit
1962 BM_ASSERT(uvalue);
1963 bit_count_v = bm::bitscan(uvalue, blist);
1964 }
1965 else
1966 bit_count_v = bm::bitscan(value, blist);
1967
1968 BM_ASSERT(bit_count_v);
1969
1970
1971 // aggregate all top bit-slices (surely greater)
1972 // TODO: use aggregator function
1973 bvector_type top_or_bv;
1974
1975 unsigned total_planes = sv.effective_slices();
1976 const bvector_type* bv_sign = sv.get_slice(0); (void)bv_sign;
1977
1978 agg_.reset();
1979 if constexpr (std::is_signed<value_type>::value)
1980 {
1981 if (value < 0)
1982 {
1983 if (!bv_sign) // no negatives at all
1984 {
1985 bv_out.swap(gtz_bv); // return all >= 0
1986 if (null_correct)
1987 correct_nulls(sv, bv_out);
1988 return;
1989 }
1990 aggregate_AND_OR_slices(top_or_bv, *bv_sign, sv, blist[bit_count_v-1]+1, total_planes);
1991 }
1992 else // value > 0
1993 {
1994 aggregate_OR_slices(top_or_bv, sv, blist[bit_count_v-1]+1, total_planes);
1995 }
1996 }
1997 else
1998 {
1999 if (total_planes < unsigned(blist[bit_count_v-1]+1))
2000 return; // number is greater than anything in this vector (empty set)
2001 aggregate_OR_slices(top_or_bv, sv, blist[bit_count_v-1]+1, total_planes);
2002 }
2003 agg_.reset();
2004
2005 bv_out.merge(top_or_bv);
2006
2007 // TODO: optimize FULL blocks
2008
2009 bvector_type and_eq_bv; // AND accum
2010 bool first = true; // flag for initial assignment
2011
2012 // GT search
2013 for (int i = int(bit_count_v)-1; i >= 0; --i)
2014 {
2015 int slice_idx = blist[i];
2016 if (slice_idx == gt_slice_limit()) // last plane
2017 break;
2018 const bvector_type* bv_base_plane = sv.get_slice(unsigned(slice_idx));
2019 if (!bv_base_plane)
2020 break;
2021 if (first)
2022 {
2023 first = false;
2024 if constexpr (std::is_signed<value_type>::value)
2025 {
2026 if (value < 0)
2027 and_eq_bv.bit_and(*bv_base_plane, *bv_sign); // use negatives for AND mask
2028 else // value > 0
2029 and_eq_bv.bit_and(*bv_base_plane, gtz_bv);
2030 }
2031 else // unsigned
2032 and_eq_bv = *bv_base_plane; // initial assignment
2033 }
2034 else
2035 and_eq_bv.bit_and(*bv_base_plane); // AND base to accumulator
2036
2037 int next_slice_idx = 0;
2038 if (i)
2039 {
2040 next_slice_idx = blist[i-1];
2041 if (slice_idx-1 == next_slice_idx)
2042 continue;
2043 ++next_slice_idx;
2044 }
2045
2046 // AND-OR the mid-planes
2047 //
2048 for (int j = slice_idx-1; j >= next_slice_idx; --j)
2049 {
2050 if constexpr (std::is_signed<value_type>::value)
2051 if (j == 0) // sign plane
2052 break; // do not process the sign plane at all
2053 if (const bvector_type* bv_sub_plane = sv.get_slice(unsigned(j)))
2054 bv_out.bit_or_and(and_eq_bv, *bv_sub_plane);
2055 } // for j
2056 } // for i
2057
2058 if constexpr (std::is_signed<value_type>::value)
2059 {
2060 if (value < 0)
2061 {
2062 // now we have negatives greter by abs value
2063 top_or_bv.set_range(0, sv.size()-1);
2064 top_or_bv.bit_sub(bv_out);
2065 bv_out.swap(top_or_bv);
2066 }
2067 else // value > 0
2068 {
2069 gtz_bv.resize(sv.size());
2070 gtz_bv.invert(); // now it is all < 0
2071 bv_out.bit_sub(gtz_bv); // exclude all negatives
2072 }
2073 }
2074
2075 decompress(sv, bv_out);
2076
2077 if (null_correct)
2078 {
2079 if constexpr (!std::is_signed<value_type>::value) // unsigned
2080 return; // NULL correction for positive values is not needed
2081 else // signed
2082 {
2083 if (value < 0)
2084 correct_nulls(sv, bv_out);
2085 }
2086 }
2087}
2088
2089//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2090
2091template<typename SV>
2092void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::aggregate_OR_slices(
2093 bvector_type& bv_target,
2094 const SV& sv,
2095 unsigned from, unsigned total_planes)
2096{
2097 for (unsigned i = from; i < total_planes; ++i)
2098 {
2099 if (const bvector_type* bv_slice = sv.get_slice(i))
2100 {
2101 BM_ASSERT(bv_slice != sv.get_null_bvector());
2102 agg_.add(bv_slice);
2103 }
2104 }
2105 agg_.combine_or(bv_target);
2106}
2107
2108//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2109
2110template<typename SV>
2111void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::aggregate_AND_OR_slices(bvector_type& bv_target,
2112 const bvector_type& bv_mask,
2113 const SV& sv,
2114 unsigned from, unsigned total_planes)
2115{
2116 for (unsigned i = from; i < total_planes; ++i)
2117 {
2118 if (const bvector_type* bv_slice = sv.get_slice(i))
2119 {
2120 BM_ASSERT(bv_slice != sv.get_null_bvector());
2121 bv_target.bit_or_and(bv_mask, *bv_slice);
2122 }
2123 }
2124}
2125
2126//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2127
2128template<typename SV>
2129bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_eq_str_prefix(const SV& sv,
2130 const typename SV::value_type* str,
2131 typename SV::bvector_type& bv_out)
2132{
2133 return find_eq_str_impl(sv, str, bv_out, false);
2134}
2135
2136
2137//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2138
2139template<typename SV>
2140bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_eq_str(const typename SV::value_type* str,
2141 typename SV::size_type& pos)
2142{
2143 BM_ASSERT(bound_sv_);
2144 return this->find_eq_str(*bound_sv_, str, pos);
2145}
2146
2147//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2148
2149template<typename SV>
2150bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_eq_str(const SV& sv,
2151 const typename SV::value_type* str,
2152 typename SV::size_type& pos)
2153{
2154 bool found = false;
2155 if (sv.empty())
2156 return found;
2157 if (*str)
2158 {
2159 bool remaped = false;
2160 if constexpr (SV::is_remap_support::value) // test remapping trait
2161 {
2162 if (sv.is_remap() && str != remap_value_vect_.data())
2163 {
2164 auto str_len = sv.effective_vector_max();
2165 remap_value_vect_.resize(str_len);
2166 remaped = sv.remap_tosv(
2167 remap_value_vect_.data(), str_len, str);
2168 if (!remaped)
2169 return remaped;
2170 str = remap_value_vect_.data();
2171 }
2172 }
2173
2174 size_type found_pos;
2175 found = find_first_eq(sv, str, found_pos, remaped);
2176 if (found)
2177 {
2178 pos = found_pos;
2179 if constexpr (SV::is_rsc_support::value) // test rank/select trait
2180 {
2181 if constexpr (sv.is_compressed()) // if compressed vector - need rank translation
2182 found = sv.find_rank(found_pos + 1, pos);
2183 }
2184 }
2185 }
2186 else // search for zero(empty str) value
2187 {
2188 // TODO: implement optimized version which would work witout temp vector
2189 typename SV::bvector_type bv_zero;
2190 find_zero(sv, bv_zero);
2191 found = bv_zero.find(pos);
2192 }
2193 return found;
2194}
2195
2196//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2197
2198template<typename SV>
2199bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_eq_str(const typename SV::value_type* str,
2200 typename SV::bvector_type& bv_out)
2201{
2202 BM_ASSERT(bound_sv_);
2203 return find_eq_str(*bound_sv_, str, bv_out);
2204}
2205
2206//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2207
2208template<typename SV>
2209bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_eq_str(const SV& sv,
2210 const typename SV::value_type* str,
2211 typename SV::bvector_type& bv_out)
2212{
2213 return find_eq_str_impl(sv, str, bv_out, true);
2214}
2215
2216//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2217
2218template<typename SV>
2219bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::remap_tosv(
2220 remap_vector_type& remap_vect_target,
2221 const typename SV::value_type* str,
2222 const SV& sv)
2223{
2224 auto str_len = sv.effective_vector_max();
2225 remap_vect_target.resize(str_len);
2226 bool remaped = sv.remap_tosv(remap_vect_target.data(), str_len, str);
2227 return remaped;
2228}
2229
2230//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2231
2232template<typename SV>
2233bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_eq_str_impl(const SV& sv,
2234 const typename SV::value_type* str,
2235 typename SV::bvector_type& bv_out,
2236 bool prefix_sub)
2237{
2238 bool found = false;
2239 bv_out.clear(true);
2240 if (sv.empty())
2241 return false; // nothing to do
2242 if constexpr (SV::is_rsc_support::value) // test rank/select trait
2243 {
2244 // search in RS compressed string vectors is not implemented
2245 BM_ASSERT(0);
2246 }
2247
2248 if (*str)
2249 {
2250 if constexpr (SV::is_remap_support::value) // test remapping trait
2251 {
2252 if (sv.is_remap() && (str != remap_value_vect_.data()))
2253 {
2254 bool remaped = remap_tosv(remap_value_vect_, str, sv);
2255 if (!remaped)
2256 return false; // not found because
2257 str = remap_value_vect_.data();
2258 }
2259 }
2260 /// aggregator search
2261 agg_.reset();
2262
2263 const unsigned common_prefix_len = 0;
2264 found = prepare_and_sub_aggregator(sv, str, common_prefix_len,
2265 prefix_sub);
2266 if (!found)
2267 return found;
2268 found = agg_.combine_and_sub(bv_out);
2269
2270 agg_.reset();
2271 }
2272 else // search for zero(empty str) value
2273 {
2274 find_zero(sv, bv_out);
2275 found = bv_out.any();
2276 }
2277 return found;
2278
2279}
2280
2281//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2282
2283template<typename SV> template<class TPipe>
2284void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_eq_str(TPipe& pipe)
2285{
2286 if (pipe.bv_and_mask_)
2287 {
2288 size_type first, last;
2289 bool any = pipe.bv_and_mask_->find_range(first, last);
2290 if (!any)
2291 return;
2292 agg_.set_range_hint(first, last);
2293 }
2294 agg_.combine_and_sub(pipe.agg_pipe_);
2295 agg_.reset_range_hint();
2296}
2297
2298//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2299
2300template<typename SV>
2301bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::bfind_eq_str(
2302 const SV& sv,
2303 const typename SV::value_type* str,
2304 typename SV::size_type& pos)
2305{
2306 bool found = false;
2307 if (sv.empty())
2308 return found;
2309
2310 if (*str)
2311 {
2312 bool remaped = false;
2313 // test search pre-condition based on remap tables
2314 if constexpr (SV::is_remap_support::value)
2315 {
2316 if (sv.is_remap() && (str != remap_value_vect_.data()))
2317 {
2318 auto str_len = sv.effective_vector_max();
2319 remap_value_vect_.resize(str_len);
2320 remaped = sv.remap_tosv(remap_value_vect_.data(), str_len, str);
2321 if (!remaped)
2322 return remaped;
2323 }
2324 }
2325
2326 reset_search_range();
2327
2328 // narrow down the search
2329 const unsigned min_distance_cutoff = bm::gap_max_bits + bm::gap_max_bits / 2;
2330 size_type l, r, dist;
2331 l = 0; r = sv.size()-1;
2332 size_type found_pos;
2333
2334 // binary search to narrow down the search window
2335 while (l <= r)
2336 {
2337 dist = r - l;
2338 if (dist < min_distance_cutoff)
2339 {
2340 // we are in an narrow <2 blocks window, but still may be in two
2341 // different neighboring blocks, lets try to narrow
2342 // to exactly one block
2343
2344 size_type nb_l = (l >> bm::set_block_shift);
2345 size_type nb_r = (r >> bm::set_block_shift);
2346 if (nb_l != nb_r)
2347 {
2348 size_type mid = nb_r * bm::gap_max_bits;
2349 if (mid < r)
2350 {
2351 int cmp = this->compare_str(sv, mid, str);
2352 if (cmp < 0) // mid < str
2353 l = mid;
2354 else
2355 r = mid-(cmp!=0); // branchless if (cmp==0) r=mid;
2356 BM_ASSERT(l < r);
2357 }
2358 nb_l = unsigned(l >> bm::set_block_shift);
2359 nb_r = unsigned(r >> bm::set_block_shift);
2360 }
2361
2362 if (nb_l == nb_r)
2363 {
2364 size_type max_nb = sv.size() >> bm::set_block_shift;
2365 if (nb_l != max_nb)
2366 {
2367 // linear in-place fixed depth scan to identify the sub-range
2368 size_type mid = nb_r * bm::gap_max_bits + bm::sub_block3_size;
2369 int cmp = this->compare_str(sv, mid, str);
2370 if (cmp < 0)
2371 {
2372 l = mid;
2373 mid = nb_r * bm::gap_max_bits + bm::sub_block3_size * 2;
2374 cmp = this->compare_str(sv, mid, str);
2375 if (cmp < 0)
2376 {
2377 l = mid;
2378 mid = nb_r * bm::gap_max_bits + bm::sub_block3_size * 3;
2379 cmp = this->compare_str(sv, mid, str);
2380 if (cmp < 0)
2381 l = mid;
2382 else
2383 r = mid;
2384 }
2385 else
2386 {
2387 r = mid;
2388 }
2389 }
2390 else
2391 {
2392 r = mid;
2393 }
2394 }
2395 }
2396
2397 set_search_range(l, r);
2398 break;
2399 }
2400
2401 typename SV::size_type mid = dist/2+l;
2402 size_type nb = (mid >> bm::set_block_shift);
2403 mid = nb * bm::gap_max_bits;
2404 if (mid <= l)
2405 {
2406 if (nb == 0 && r > bm::gap_max_bits)
2407 mid = bm::gap_max_bits;
2408 else
2409 mid = dist / 2 + l;
2410 }
2411 BM_ASSERT(mid > l);
2412
2413 int cmp = this->compare_str(sv, mid, str);
2414 if (cmp == 0)
2415 {
2416 found_pos = mid;
2417 found = true;
2418 set_search_range(l, mid);
2419 break;
2420 }
2421 if (cmp < 0)
2422 l = mid+1;
2423 else
2424 r = mid-1;
2425 } // while
2426
2427 // use linear search (range is set)
2428 found = find_first_eq(sv, str, found_pos, remaped);
2429 if (found)
2430 {
2431 pos = found_pos;
2432 if constexpr (SV::is_compressed()) // if compressed vector - need rank translation
2433 found = sv.find_rank(found_pos + 1, pos);
2434 }
2435 reset_search_range();
2436 }
2437 else // search for zero value
2438 {
2439 // TODO: implement optimized version which would work without temp vector
2440 typename SV::bvector_type bv_zero;
2441 find_zero(sv, bv_zero);
2442 found = bv_zero.find(pos);
2443 }
2444 return found;
2445}
2446
2447//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2448
2449template<typename SV>
2450bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::bfind_eq_str(const typename SV::value_type* str,
2451 typename SV::size_type& pos)
2452{
2453 BM_ASSERT(bound_sv_);
2454 return bfind_eq_str(*bound_sv_, str, pos);
2455}
2456
2457//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2458
2459template<typename SV>
2460bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::bfind(const SV& sv,
2461 const typename SV::value_type val,
2462 typename SV::size_type& pos)
2463{
2464 int cmp;
2465 size_type l = 0, r = sv.size();
2466 if (l == r) // empty vector
2467 {
2468 pos = 0;
2469 return false;
2470 }
2471 --r;
2472
2473 // check initial boundary conditions if insert point is at tail/head
2474 cmp = this->compare(sv, l, val); // left (0) boundary check
2475 if (cmp > 0) // vect[x] > str
2476 {
2477 pos = 0;
2478 return false;
2479 }
2480 if (cmp == 0)
2481 {
2482 pos = 0;
2483 return true;
2484 }
2485 cmp = this->compare(sv, r, val); // right(size-1) boundary check
2486 if (cmp == 0)
2487 {
2488 pos = r;
2489 // back-scan to rewind all duplicates
2490 // TODO: adapt one-sided binary search to traverse large platos
2491 for (; r >= 0; --r)
2492 {
2493 cmp = this->compare(sv, r, val);
2494 if (cmp != 0)
2495 return true;
2496 pos = r;
2497 } // for i
2498 return true;
2499 }
2500 if (cmp < 0) // vect[x] < str
2501 {
2502 pos = r+1;
2503 return false;
2504 }
2505
2506 size_type dist = r - l;
2507 if (dist < linear_cutoff1)
2508 {
2509 for (; l <= r; ++l)
2510 {
2511 cmp = this->compare(sv, l, val);
2512 if (cmp == 0)
2513 {
2514 pos = l;
2515 return true;
2516 }
2517 if (cmp > 0)
2518 {
2519 pos = l;
2520 return false;
2521 }
2522 } // for
2523 }
2524
2525 while (l <= r)
2526 {
2527 size_type mid = (r-l)/2+l;
2528 cmp = this->compare(sv, mid, val);
2529 if (cmp == 0)
2530 {
2531 pos = mid;
2532 // back-scan to rewind all duplicates
2533 for (size_type i = mid-1; i >= 0; --i)
2534 {
2535 cmp = this->compare(sv, i, val);
2536 if (cmp != 0)
2537 return true;
2538 pos = i;
2539 } // for i
2540 pos = 0;
2541 return true;
2542 }
2543 if (cmp < 0)
2544 l = mid+1;
2545 else
2546 r = mid-1;
2547
2548 dist = r - l;
2549 if (dist < linear_cutoff2) // do linear scan here
2550 {
2551 typename SV::const_iterator it(&sv, l);
2552 for (; it.valid(); ++it, ++l)
2553 {
2554 typename SV::value_type sv_value = it.value();
2555 if (sv_value == val)
2556 {
2557 pos = l;
2558 return true;
2559 }
2560 if (sv_value > val) // vect[x] > val
2561 {
2562 pos = l;
2563 return false;
2564 }
2565 } // for it
2566 BM_ASSERT(0);
2567 pos = l;
2568 return false;
2569 }
2570 } // while
2571
2572 BM_ASSERT(0);
2573 return false;
2574}
2575
2576
2577//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2578
2579template<typename SV>
2580bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::lower_bound_str(
2581 const SV& sv,
2582 const typename SV::value_type* str,
2583 typename SV::size_type& pos)
2584{
2585 int cmp;
2586 size_type l = 0, r = sv.size();
2587
2588 if (l == r) // empty vector
2589 {
2590 pos = 0;
2591 return false;
2592 }
2593 --r;
2594
2595 // check initial boundary conditions if insert point is at tail/head
2596 cmp = this->compare_str(sv, l, str); // left (0) boundary check
2597 if (cmp > 0) // vect[x] > str
2598 {
2599 pos = 0;
2600 return false;
2601 }
2602 if (cmp == 0)
2603 {
2604 pos = 0;
2605 return true;
2606 }
2607 cmp = this->compare_str(sv, r, str); // right(size-1) boundary check
2608 if (cmp == 0)
2609 {
2610 pos = r;
2611 // back-scan to rewind all duplicates
2612 // TODO: adapt one-sided binary search to traverse large platos
2613 for (; r >= 0; --r)
2614 {
2615 cmp = this->compare_str(sv, r, str);
2616 if (cmp != 0)
2617 return true;
2618 pos = r;
2619 } // for i
2620 return true;
2621 }
2622 if (cmp < 0) // vect[x] < str
2623 {
2624 pos = r+1;
2625 return false;
2626 }
2627
2628 size_type dist = r - l;
2629 if (dist < linear_cutoff1)
2630 {
2631 for (; l <= r; ++l)
2632 {
2633 cmp = this->compare_str(sv, l, str);
2634 if (cmp == 0)
2635 {
2636 pos = l;
2637 return true;
2638 }
2639 if (cmp > 0)
2640 {
2641 pos = l;
2642 return false;
2643 }
2644 } // for
2645 }
2646 while (l <= r)
2647 {
2648 size_type mid = (r-l)/2+l;
2649 cmp = this->compare_str(sv, mid, str);
2650 if (cmp == 0)
2651 {
2652 pos = mid;
2653 // back-scan to rewind all duplicates
2654 for (size_type i = mid-1; i >= 0; --i)
2655 {
2656 cmp = this->compare_str(sv, i, str);
2657 if (cmp != 0)
2658 return true;
2659 pos = i;
2660 } // for i
2661 pos = 0;
2662 return true;
2663 }
2664 if (cmp < 0)
2665 l = mid+1;
2666 else
2667 r = mid-1;
2668
2669 dist = r - l;
2670 if (dist < linear_cutoff2) // do linear scan here
2671 {
2672 if (!hmatr_.is_init())
2673 {
2674 unsigned max_str = (unsigned)sv.effective_max_str();
2675 hmatr_.resize(linear_cutoff2, max_str+1, false);
2676 }
2677
2678 dist = sv.decode(hmatr_, l, dist+1);
2679 for (unsigned i = 0; i < dist; ++i, ++l)
2680 {
2681 const typename SV::value_type* hm_str = hmatr_.row(i);
2682 cmp = ::strcmp(hm_str, str);
2683 if (cmp == 0)
2684 {
2685 pos = l;
2686 return true;
2687 }
2688 if (cmp > 0) // vect[x] > str
2689 {
2690 pos = l;
2691 return false;
2692 }
2693 }
2694 cmp = this->compare_str(sv, l, str);
2695 if (cmp > 0) // vect[x] > str
2696 {
2697 pos = l;
2698 return false;
2699 }
2700 BM_ASSERT(0);
2701 pos = l;
2702 return false;
2703 }
2704 } // while
2705
2706 BM_ASSERT(0);
2707 return false;
2708}
2709
2710
2711//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2712
2713template<typename SV>
2714int sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::compare_str(const SV& sv,
2715 size_type idx,
2716 const value_type* str)
2717{
2718 if (bound_sv_ == &sv)
2719 {
2720 size_type nb = (idx >> bm::set_block_shift);
2721 size_type nbit = (idx & bm::set_block_mask);
2722 if (nbit == 0) // access to sentinel, first block element
2723 {
2724 value_type* s0 = block0_elements_cache_.row(nb);
2725 if (*s0 == 0) // uninitialized element
2726 {
2727 sv.get(idx, s0, size_type(block0_elements_cache_.cols()));
2728 }
2729 int res = 0;
2730 for (unsigned i = 0; i < block0_elements_cache_.cols(); ++i)
2731 {
2732 char octet = str[i]; char value = s0[i];
2733 res = (value > octet) - (value < octet);
2734 if (res || !octet)
2735 break;
2736 } // for i
2737 return res;
2738 }
2739 else
2740 {
2741 if (nbit % bm::sub_block3_size == 0) // TODO: use AND mask here
2742 {
2743 size_type k = nbit / bm::sub_block3_size - 1;
2744 value_type* s1 = block3_elements_cache_.row(nb * 3 + k);
2745 int res = 0;
2746 for (unsigned i = 0; i < block3_elements_cache_.cols(); ++i)
2747 {
2748 char octet = str[i]; char value = s1[i];
2749 res = (value > octet) - (value < octet);
2750 if (res || !octet)
2751 break;
2752 } // for i
2753 return res;
2754 }
2755 }
2756 }
2757 return sv.compare(idx, str);
2758}
2759
2760//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2761
2762template<typename SV>
2763int sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::compare(const SV& sv,
2764 size_type idx,
2765 const value_type val) BMNOEXCEPT
2766{
2767 // TODO: implement sentinel elements cache (similar to compare_str())
2768 return sv.compare(idx, val);
2769}
2770
2771//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2772
2773template<typename SV>
2774void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_eq(const SV& sv,
2775 typename SV::value_type value,
2776 typename SV::bvector_type& bv_out)
2777{
2778 if (sv.empty())
2779 {
2780 bv_out.clear();
2781 return; // nothing to do
2782 }
2783 if (!value)
2784 {
2785 find_zero(sv, bv_out);
2786 return;
2787 }
2788
2789 find_eq_with_nulls(sv, value, bv_out, 0);
2790
2791 decompress(sv, bv_out);
2792 correct_nulls(sv, bv_out);
2793}
2794
2795//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2796
2797template<typename SV>
2798bool sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_eq(const SV& sv,
2799 typename SV::value_type value,
2800 typename SV::size_type& pos)
2801{
2802 if (!value) // zero value - special case
2803 {
2804 bvector_type bv_zero;
2805 find_eq(sv, value, bv_zero);
2806 bool found = bv_zero.find(pos);
2807 return found;
2808 }
2809
2810 size_type found_pos;
2811 bool found = find_first_eq(sv, value, found_pos);
2812 if (found)
2813 {
2814 pos = found_pos;
2815 if (bm::conditional<SV::is_rsc_support::value>::test()) // test rank/select trait
2816 {
2817 if constexpr (SV::is_compressed()) // if compressed vector - need rank translation
2818 found = sv.find_rank(found_pos + 1, pos);
2819 }
2820 }
2821 return found;
2822}
2823
2824//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2825
2826template<typename SV>
2827void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_nonzero(const SV& sv,
2828 typename SV::bvector_type& bv_out)
2829{
2830 agg_.reset(); // in case if previous scan was interrupted
2831 auto sz = sv.effective_slices(); // sv.slices();
2832 for (unsigned i = 0; i < sz; ++i)
2833 agg_.add(sv.get_slice(i));
2834 agg_.combine_or(bv_out);
2835 agg_.reset();
2836}
2837
2838//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2839
2840template<typename SV>
2841void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::find_positive(const SV& sv,
2842 typename SV::bvector_type& bv_out)
2843{
2844 BM_ASSERT(sv.size());
2845 bv_out.set_range(0, sv.size()-1); // select all elements
2846 if constexpr (std::is_signed<value_type>::value)
2847 {
2848 if (const bvector_type* bv_sign = sv.get_slice(0)) // sign bvector
2849 bv_out.bit_sub(*bv_sign); // all MINUS negatives
2850 }
2851}
2852
2853//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2854
2855template<typename SV>
2856void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::decompress(const SV& sv,
2857 typename SV::bvector_type& bv_out)
2858{
2859 if constexpr (SV::is_compressed())
2860 {
2861 const bvector_type* bv_non_null = sv.get_null_bvector();
2862 BM_ASSERT(bv_non_null);
2863
2864 // TODO: implement faster decompressor for small result-sets
2865 rank_compr_.decompress(bv_tmp_, *bv_non_null, bv_out);
2866 bv_out.swap(bv_tmp_);
2867 }
2868 else
2869 {
2870 (void)sv; (void)bv_out;
2871 }
2872}
2873
2874//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2875
2876template<typename SV>
2877void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::set_search_range(size_type from, size_type to)
2878{
2879 BM_ASSERT(from < to);
2880 mask_from_ = from;
2881 mask_to_ = to;
2882 mask_set_ = true;
2883}
2884
2885//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2886
2887template<typename SV>
2888void sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::reset_search_range()
2889{
2890 mask_set_ = false;
2891 mask_from_ = mask_to_ = bm::id_max;
2892}
2893
2894
2895//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2896// sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::pipeline<Opt>
2897//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2898
2899template<typename SV> template<class Opt>
2900void
2901sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::pipeline<Opt>::set_search_mask(const bvector_type* bv_mask) BMNOEXCEPT
2902{
2903 static_assert(Opt::is_masks(),
2904 "BM: Search masking needs to be enabled in template parameter options before function call. see bm::agg_run_options<> ");
2905 bv_and_mask_ = bv_mask;
2906}
2907
2908//----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2909
2910template<typename SV> template<class Opt>
2911void
2912sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::pipeline<Opt>::add(const typename SV::value_type* str)
2913{
2914 BM_ASSERT(str);
2915
2916 typename aggregator_type::arg_groups* arg = agg_pipe_.add();
2917 BM_ASSERT(arg);
2918
2919 if constexpr (SV::is_remap_support::value) // test remapping trait
2920 {
2921 if (sv_.is_remap() && (str != remap_value_vect_.data()))
2922 {
2923 bool remaped = remap_tosv(remap_value_vect_, str, sv_);
2924 if (!remaped)
2925 return; // not found (leaves the arg(arg_group) empty
2926 str = remap_value_vect_.data();
2927 }
2928 }
2929 int len = 0;
2930 for (; str[len] != 0; ++len)
2931 {}
2932 BM_ASSERT(len);
2933
2934 if constexpr(Opt::is_masks())
2935 arg->add(bv_and_mask_, 0);
2936 arg->add(sv_.get_null_bvector(), 0);
2937
2938 // use reverse order (faster for sorted arrays)
2939
2940 for (int octet_idx = len-1; octet_idx >= 0; --octet_idx)
2941 {
2942 //if (unsigned(octet_idx) < octet_start) // common prefix
2943 // break;
2944
2945 unsigned value = unsigned(str[octet_idx]) & 0xFF;
2946 BM_ASSERT(value != 0);
2947
2948 bm::id64_t planes_mask;
2949 #if (0)
2950 if (&sv == bound_sv_)
2951 planes_mask = vector_plane_masks_[unsigned(octet_idx)];
2952 else
2953 #endif
2954 planes_mask = sv_.get_slice_mask(unsigned(octet_idx));
2955
2956 if ((value & planes_mask) != value) // pre-screen for impossible values
2957 {
2958 arg->reset(); // reset is necessary to disable single plane AND
2959 return; // found non-existing plane
2960 }
2961
2962 sparse_vector_scanner<SV>::add_agg_char(
2963 *arg, sv_, octet_idx, planes_mask, value); // AND-SUB aggregator
2964 } // for octet_idx
2965
2966
2967 // add all vectors above string len to the SUB aggregation group
2968 //
2969 //if (prefix_sub)
2970 {
2971 unsigned plane_idx = unsigned(len * 8);
2972 // SUB group should NOt include not NULL bvector
2973 size_type planes = size_type(this->eff_slices_);
2974 for (; plane_idx < planes; ++plane_idx)
2975 {
2976 if (bvector_type_const_ptr bv = sv_.get_slice(plane_idx))
2977 arg->add(bv, 1); // agg to SUB group
2978 } // for
2979 }
2980
2981}
2982
